reviewText: This is definately worth watching.  Is an area of great interest to me, always has been.  The way these guys go about looking in to unique spots to investigate is well done and holds your attention fro start to finish.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I sat through two and a half episodes of this show.  I thought the first episode was terrible, but decided to give them another chance.  The second show was almost as bad as the first.  By the third show, I had to shut it off half way through.  Even though Amazon Prime gives this show away for FREE, I just can't stomach it.  What is so appealing about two annoying overweight brothers with LOUD Texas accents, a pickup truck and a trailer full of giant television sets from Costco?  Even the bleach blonde sidekick looks like she's been around the block a few too many times.  They take the simplest, most obvious and quite frankly, BORING, aspects of Ghost Hunters and Ghost Adventures and try to put a southern spin on it.  The end result is that it falls flat on its face.  This show is as entertaining as an infomercial.  The only voice I can stand to listen to is Mike Rowe, who must be under some kind of unholy contractual commitment with the Discovery Channel to do schlep like this.  Please, Discovery Channel, cancel this show and replace it with something about people who have 30 kids who all wear tiaras; it'd be less damaging to our brains.
summary: Even though it's free with Prime, I don't want to watch it.

Title: N/A

reviewText: They call this science?  Old houses creaking and groaning as the temperature changes, unconfirmed stories from people who were most likely experiencing a waking dream, fluctuating electromagnetic readings in rooms with light fixtures and electrical outlets and unintelligible noises that they claim are voices of the dead saying things that only a lot of imagination can make sense of do not constitute evidence of ghosts.  The gullibility of this group is truly legendary and there is absolutely nothing in any of these episodes that even remotely constitutes proof of ghosts.  This would fly better as a comedy highlighting the credulity of people.

reviewText: I enjoyed the cast and watching them use  all of the new  technical equipment that they were given to use. A lot of the other shows do not look at the science behind the phenomena and that is what I enjoyed learning about the most.

reviewText: I am a fan of this show. I washed a few other paranormal investigative shows and didn't like some and just flat out hated others. This show can be a little hokey at times but it is entertaining. I like the EVP's on this show MUCH more than the other shows I have seen, its is more eventful, pretty cool settings, and good selection on locations. The only episode that just made me shake my head was the John Wilkes Booth episode. The main guy Brad needs to chill out with his yelling and smack talk to ghosts but one of them pays him back in this season. Overall if you like this type of show it is very entertaining.
summary: A little hokey sometimes but entertaining.
Title: N/A
